Author: DanielBMarkham
Title: Ethics, Morals, and the Law: Where do you draw the line at what to develop?

Author: gibsonf1
Content: My compliments to immad for a truly compelling "must see" headline for this site.

Author: DanielBMarkham
Content:
I believe you are saying that it's okay to have product business (beanie-babies) and also that it's not okay to have a product business (his stuff).

\nI, for one, would like to hear about web businesses that integrate product sales into lifestyles. I think it's fine to draw the line at "stuff we think might be illegal and/or bad for people" but I sure would like to talk more about product-based web applications if that's okay with everybody.

Author: drm237
Title: Change is in the air for old guard Boston area VC's

Author: joshwa
Content:
> If he had a business selling beanie-babies online with a slick AJAX interface I don't think anyone would care.

But he doesn't. There's nothing even remotely on-topic about his business... news.yc seems to be mostly about tech startups, or, at the very least, about new and disruptive business models. This is a fairly straightforward product business (with a few regulatory/marketing issues).

Besides the social engineering of this site, there's not a much in the way of 'hacking' going on with his business. Thus, to me (and plenty of others), it's off-topic here.

Author: rms
Content: Yes, there is a difference between kratom and what I suspect was one of the true "Things you can't say": X racial/ethnic subgroup is better at n subtask than Y racial/ethnic subgroup

Author: rms
Content:
I've looked into submitting kratom for approval as a supplement. You send a letter to the FDA and then they inspect the facility where the supplement is produced.

Kratom will become illegal if there is political pressure to do so. I hope that the current political climate has moved far enough past war-on-drugs hysteria for this to happen.

Author: intellectronica
Content: Launchad [ https://launchpad.net/ ] is a fantastic option if you're working on a free software project. It's free and hosted and has some great features you don't find in any of the other trackers.

Author: falsestprophet
Content:
"If it was "poisoning people", they wouldn't have continued using it."

That is utterly false.

"If you are actually into the pharmacology industry, then you would know that most pharmaceuticals are derived from plants, fungi, or other organisms."

Well that has been the case for a very long time. This process is called drug discovery. We are going to be in a very good position to solve the "forward problem" in the near future. With adequate structure-activity models then computationally designed drugs are a real possibility.

It is an exciting time for a hacker to be a chemical engineer.

Author: davidw
Content: I can tolerate people who are boring or annoying, just don't enjoy it. I think even really extroverted people have people they don't care for. In any case, it's not like I'm one of those people who consider everyone beneath them - my "boring/annoying" people filter doesn't catch that many people.
